inlineContent.text: provides an interface for reading a byte stream either synchronously or asynchronously. You can create streams that read bytes from a block of memory, a file, or a generic socket. All streams need to be opened, using
for writing byte streams. The CFNetwork framework defines an additional type of stream for reading responses to HTTP requests.
CFReadStream is “toll-free bridged” with its Cocoa Foundation counterpart,
. This means that the Core Foundation type is interchangeable in function or method calls with the bridged Foundation object. Therefore, in a method where you see an
parameter, you can pass in a CFReadStreamRef, and in a function where you see a CFReadStreamRef parameter, you can pass in an
instance. Note, however, that you may have either a delegate or callbacks but not both. See
for more information on toll-free bridging.

abstract.text: Schedules a stream into a run loop.
Sets the value of a property for a stream.
Returns the current state of a stream.
Returns the error status of a stream.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a readable stream has data that can be read without blocking.
Creates a readable stream for a block of memory.
Assigns a client to a stream, which receives callbacks when certain events occur.
Removes a read stream from a given run loop.
Returns the error associated with a stream.
Returns a pointer to a stream’s internal buffer of unread data, if possible.
Reads data from a readable stream.
Closes a readable stream.
Returns the value of a property for a stream.
Creates a readable stream for a file.
Opens a stream for reading.
Returns the type identifier the
opaque type.
The CFFileDescriptor provides an opaque type to monitor file descriptors for read and write activity via CFRunLoop.
A reference to a readable stream object.
Callback invoked when certain types of activity takes place on a readable stream.
A structure that contains program-defined data and callbacks with which you can configure a stream’s client behavior.

CFStringTokenizer allows you to tokenize strings into words, sentences or paragraphs in a language-neutral way. It supports languages such as Japanese and Chinese that do not delimit words by spaces, as well as de-compounding German compounds. You can obtain Latin transcription for tokens. It also provides language identification API.
